onStop().Description: Called when the Fragment is no longer started. This is generally tied to @B_android#app#Activity#onStop_E@ of the containing Activity's lifecycle.

onPrepareCallbackFlags().Description: Called to prepare the callback flags that will be used when the @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#Callback_E@ is registered. The default implementation returns @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#CALLBACK_FLAG_REQUEST_DISCOVERY_E@.

getRouteSelector().Description: Gets the media route selector for filtering the routes to be discovered.

Returns: The new callback, or null if no callback should be registered.
onCreateCallback().Description: Called to create the @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#Callback_E@ that will be registered. The default callback does nothing. The application may override this method to supply its own callback.

onStart().Description: Called when the Fragment is visible to the user. This is generally tied to @B_android#app#Activity#onStart_E@ of the containing Activity's lifecycle.

ClassDesc: Media route discovery fragment. This fragment takes care of registering a callback for media route discovery during the @B_android#support#v4#app#Fragment#onStart_E@ phase and removing it during the @B_android#support#v4#app#Fragment#onStop_E@ phase. The application must supply a route selector to specify the kinds of routes to discover. The application may also override @B_android#support#v7#app#MediaRouteDiscoveryFragment#onCreateCallback_E@ to provide the @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter_E@ callback to register. Note that the discovery callback makes the application be connected with all the @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouteProviderService_E@ while it is registered.
